name: gusplease
text: I bet that, one day, this will be the strip with the most comments.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Only 16 so far.

name: neonaoneo
text:
69 after this. Meanwhile, the one with the most has over 2000.

Unfortunately, I don't think it will happen

name: the_voice
text: Now 72. I was about to write "Now 71", but I realized that I would be 72 AND I BLEW MY MIND TO SHIT.

name: red-barchetta
text: I don't even bother to read the comments on the newer strips for the reason spinynorman gives. What ever happened to assetbar ruined the whole damn thing. It's the equivalent of recess at elementary school.

name: sixtyswine
text: Now 101!

name: peng33
text: now one more than it did, previously!

name: lolsworth
text: Now that's what I call music!

name: spinynorman
text:
Usually the strips with the most comments are very recent ones in which a whole mess of bitching and replying occur.

Doesn't have anything to do with the strip itself, more to do with what the guy above you said.

name: deovalente
text: Shut up you're totally wrong and you suck.

name: spinynorman
text: Well, fuck you too, buddy.

name: deovalente
text: Oh yeah well I'm rubber you're glue.

name: spinynorman
text: Yeah, well, I bet you're a really crappy kind of rubber, because you're communist so it's made in some sort of gray cement Soviet bloc factory where an elderly horse walking in a circle is an intrinsic part of the machinery.

name: deovalente
text: Description of Soviet rubber factory--is SO goot.

name: spinynorman
text: Thanks. I tried.

name: soticoto
text:
A long time ago, in a galaxy far... wait... no.
Earlier strip. MUCH earlier strip. Someone expressed their surprise at your ability to perpetually draw the chubb to yourself.

... I'm seeing it here.
I'm seeing it here, and yes everyone knows this whole exchange is satirical...

So how do you do it?
Is it, as a cynic would say, merely the avatar? Or is it the reputation? Or both?

name: salvagebar
text: I tried to chubby this whole exchange, and ran out of chubbies.

name: tollschaft
text: I want to chubby this comment because i tried to do the same thing, but i'm outta chubbs :(

name: drskradley
text: There was serving here. The serving upon the Communist was cold .

name: firesign
text:
Concept: spinynorman (1st post)
Execution: deovalente (all replies)

name: fermatprime
text: Totally not getting it: The two people who lamed several posts in the exchange

name: scorpio_nadir
text: The Commissars have people everywhere , Comrade.

name: beansdooma
text: yeah you were pretty far off

name: broahsaurus
text: Prediction aside, this strip still stands as one of the best based on the fact that Ray is sidetracked from plying his mother with alcohol to sidetrack her from learning about his new testicle-related business by wanting to follow in his father's shoes by winning a fight in which participants can die.

name: senor_diablo
text: I think this is one of the best plotlines in the Achewood community!

name: ferdinand
text: A comment left by ferdinand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NeoNaoNeo, maxmax, Jalhalla42, cailetshadow)

name: dumase
text: Somebody always says this at the beginning of every story arc. LET'S JUST SAY THEY'RE ALL EQUALLY GOOD SO WE CAN STOP HAVING THESE COMMENTS

name: snowman
text: no

name: tragicone
text: Perhaps only bested by those that soon followed: IE fake phallus and phillipe goes to the dump.

name: mustakrakesh
text: My favorite is the Ray/ Roast Beef road trip back in '02 I love that arc.

name: hannah
text: this is the beginning of a beautiful arc.

name: peterjoel
text: and it gets a 5 just on that merit.

name: riazm
text: Check this blog entry. for the beginning of the legend that is....RAMSES LUTHER SMUCKLES

name: mockereo
text:
Every time I come across this comic in my re-reading, I read the whole GOF arc. No exceptions.

No complaints either!

name: craigola
text: Sometimes, when I'm having a low day, a thought of the Great Outdoor Fight crosses my mind for a minute, and makes all the difference in the world.

name: evilpaul
text: 5 for being the start of my favorite arc.

name: miku224
text: Discovered today that greatoutdoorfight.com is an actual wiki-like archive of the GOF.  Who knew?

name: bourbonsamurai
text: That is awesome. I'm loving "The Toronto Man Machine".

name: the_doz
text:
This desperately needs more chubbies.

How did I not find out about this until now?

name: drskradley
text: Man alive, I love that avatar.  Please post more often so I can view it more.

name: gunsofray
text: i have spent a while searching for the man or woman who registered it. Pluton is the allehged username, but i haven't found this mythical being...

name: trollcollins
text:
For whatever reason, Mrs. Smuckles's love of cod really delights me.

"This cod is delicious!"

I agree, Mrs. Smuckles. Cod is the best whitefish. Take that, halibut!

name: cailetshadow
text: It was all so long ago that your father loved cod.

name: trollcollins
text:
Cod au gratin is the most nutritious dish of fish.

You should try to keep the cheese on as weight.

name: the_dude
text: WASNT HE GRILLING UP STEAKS A MINUTE AGO?!

name: smilebuddha
text: Good to see I wasn't the only person thinking that...

name: tekende
text: He checked to see if he was grilling any ribeye and was surprised to discover he was actually grilling up cod.

name: snowman
text: Just as the mimosa was actually chablis

name: hellofyellin
text: I approve of this post.

name: farqussus
text: I will thank you to try barramundi and revoke your assessment.

name: trollcollins
text: Unfortunately, where I live it is treason against the state to speak ill of cod. For a time I was on a government watch list for publicly declaring tilapia a satisfactory cod substitute.

name: foea
text: They're really different.. cod is flatfish, all flaky and fatty.. barramundi may as well be white salmon.. it's a fine fish, mind you, but apples/oranges and all.

name: trollcollins
text: Cod is definitely flakey but it actually it is not too fatty and it certainly is not flat. Your informant has mislead you as to the flatness of cod! It is a normal shaped fish that swims normally, not along the bottom with two eyes on one side and what have you. I mean cod can grow really huge (6 feet huge), although not if we fish them like the Dickens (as we have done).

name: foea
text: I apparently misunderstand cod, but I am positive that tilapia is not a satisfactory substitute for it. Tilapia is grown in buckets of garbage.

name: trollcollins
text: Lobsters are sea-cockroaches! Mushrooms grow on dungheaps. It is not good to inquire too deeply into things that are tasty.

name: sargasm
text: She gave him the idea, didn't she?!  You can see him realizing it in panel 10!

name: straw
text: Ray's expression on 10 is pure gold

name: wae
text: i can't believe that the whole Great Outdoor Fight started with a single nutsack attached to a cellphone

name: spinynorman
text:
That always throws me when I skip to this arc.

"...oh, yeah."

name: killingthejay
text: Not only that, but all this happened because TODD invited Ray's mom over!  Who says the the the li'l shitbag never does any good?

name: geozimmdrake
text: you think onstad had the great outdoor fight already planned out when todd came to ray all 'lets put a penis on the bottom of a car!' or did the story just kind of evolve as it went?  i like to think he had it planned out all along, but i dunno.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Probably worked backwards. Like,

1. Concept of Great Outdoor Fight
2. Ray enters Great Outdoor Fight
3. He does this because his father did it, and won, before him.
4. Ray finds this out from his mother.
5. His mother is visiting.
6. She is visiting to check out some new crazy business venture of Ray's
7. Something to do with testicles?
8. Suggested by Todd?

name: atticusonline
text: Haha beautifully woven.

name: teknofatcat
text: Best. Arc. Ever.

name: senseihollywood
text: I thought they were gonna have rib-eyes and mimosas...Ray was really pushing that menu earlier...

name: aaron_haynes
text: It turns out it wasn't mimosa.

name: stormagnet
text: Maybe Rays getting all classy and doing dinner in courses... like, next they'll have a nice cleasnsing sherbet before moving on to their Rib-Eyes.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Ray basically gets his own mother drunk so she'll fess up about his father's past.

name: cdl146
text: I love how Onstad went straight from the Anatomix to this.

name: lrosetw8
text: Godammit why is the storyarc so amazing?? Somebody please tell me.

name: gormster
text: Er, have you tried reading it?

name: jyuu
text: From all the comments I've seen on other strips referring to this arc, I am so looking forward to it. Here is my comment so I can come back afterwards and reflect on how innocent I was and how I wish I could be reading it for the first time all over again.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I just started reading from the beginning about a month ago and have been anticipating the GOF for quite awhile.
Hell, I signed up for an account just to commemorate the experience because I can distinctly hear thunder rumbling in the back of my brain.
Reading the forum makes this comic even more enjoyable.

name: stormagnet
text: And four months later, here I am performing the same pilgrimage.

name: shogun
text: Cartillage Head AND the Great Outdoor Fight, in the same day!  This trek is covering the whole spectrum.

name: i_love_kate
text:
I'd have to do some serious back reading to find any story arc in a webcomic which I prefer to the GOF. Penny Arcade's are good, but all terribly short... Scary Go Round has some excellent ones. Beaver and Steve would rank highly for the one with Sir Isaac Newton.

I should compile this list.

name: imbeta
text: Dude! Look at those animals on the website, they're SO BUFF!!!

name: quarantine
text: Hands-down the best story arc, ever.

name: arthurdentlives
text: Oh sweet Great Outdoor Fight.  How I've longed to actually read thee.

name: envika
text: Here, have more Chablis.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: filling her wineglass until it is almost overflowing

name: windfish
text: Men die.

name: wittyname
text:
I like how Ray's mother unintentionally gives the great advertisement for the fight.

The Great Outdoor Fight. Men Die.

name: riazm
text:
Consider:

Ramses took his girlfriend to the GOF on his motorcycle.

Ray was sitting in the sidecar when Roast Beef drove to the fight.

What I'm saying here is that Ray is the woman in his relationship with Beef.

name: notcool
text:
Actually, when you get right down to it, the GOF was where Ramses PROPOSED to Ray's mom.

listen to the reel-to-reels with Beef. He will show you the way .

name: vermy
text: The ornate illustration of muscled cats takes the cake

name: gmm
text: So I finally reach the much-discussed Great Outdoor Fight for the first time. I've got to tell you, fellow archive trawlers, I'm pretty excited.

name: deusoma
text: Ray's Mom speaks pretty highly of Ramses considering he ran out on her and her baby. I mean, yeah, he was The Man with the Blood on His Hands, but that's still a pretty harsh thing to do.

name: uruloki
text: the beginning of a legend

name: comrade_tom
text: was this posted on a cod friday?

name: melchizedek
text: This one *should* have most comments. Life isn't about facts, it's about ambitions.

name: direhaggis
text: Is it just me or does Mrs. Smuckles' glasses look upside -down?

name: firesign
text: I don't know what details really need to be forthcoming (alt text). "Three days. Three acres. Three thousand men." as a tagline for "The Great Outdoor Fight" where "only one will win" pretty much sums it up. An entire organized sport/concept summed up in a mere 15 words, and everyone knows exactly what's going on. Short, to the point, and awesome.

name: alzuna
text:
FINALLY

I have been reading about this arc forever in the comments and now with the book coming out I wanted to just skip ahead and read it, but I made myself wait until I actually got to it.

NOW I finally get to read in context. Hellz yea.

name: invidious
text:
Yes, it's the beginning of a fabulous arc... but I'm amazed no one has mentioned how awesome panel #7 is.

His fighting was just something he had to do, like walk or breathe.

name: doomchild
text:
Some people expand and contract their lungs via the pumping action of the diaphragm. Ramses Luther shatters ribcages and uses beer bottles to aerate skulls.

DC

name: atticusonline
text: why do you sign your name DC when we can all clearly see that your name is doomchild?

name: doomchild
text:
I don't know, actually. I do the same thing with emails and forum posts. I guess it's kind of like a signature at the bottom of a letter. My name might be on the envelope, but it should also be on the message.

DC

name: atticusonline
text:
...touche


or should i say


... touche

name: atticusonline
text:
It has now been 5 months later and I have decided on


... touche

name: shebajones
text: I had a dream about the GOF last night. Dolly Parton totally kicked my ass. :(

name: wonelove
text: And so it begins, the greatest story arc in all of Achewood history

name: red-barchetta
text: The look on Rays face on panel 10, you can tell he's no longer aware that his mother is in the room. His mind a whirl with grand designs of the GOF.

name: cailetshadow
text: Ray's mother knows how to say all the exactly wrong things to prevent Ray from entering this fight.

name: cdcw
text: I started reading the archives from the beggining again and the whole time I was anticipating this story line, yay here we go again.

name: gethen
text: can't you hear the music crescendo when those words are spoken?

name: deadpool
text: I never thought about it til rereading this strip. But Ray's glasses defy the laws of physics.

name: saintentreri
text: Keepin' the OP dream alive.

name: genequagmire
text: And so it begins.

name: lolsworth
text: And so it...boned?
